In this post I am going to download tweets using **tweetR** package.

1. You have to have a twitter account. If you do not have, create a twitter account on [twitter.com](https://twitter.com).

2. Create a twitter application on [apps.twitter.com](https://apps.twitter.com). There, you have to insert a number of information that will be used to collect tweets. Once, you created an application, you will have access to _API Key_ and _API Secret_ in the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab. In the same tab, you can create _access tokens_ too (no picture is provided here).

![](/post/2018-06-13-collecting-tweets_files/Screen Shot 2018-06-13 at 5.58.31 PM.png){width=100%}

3. Go to RStudio: install and attach **tweetR** package.

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
# install.packages("twitteR")
# library(twitteR)
```

4. From step 2, insert **API Key**, **API Secret**, **Access Token**, and **Access Secret** into the following code chunk.

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
api_key <- "YOUR_API_KEY"
api_secret <- "YOUR_API_SECRET"
access_token <- "YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN"
access_secret <- "YOUR_ACCESS_SECRET"
```

5. Now, setup the twitter

```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
setup_twitter_oauth(consumer_key = api_key, 
                    consumer_secret = api_secret, 
                    access_token=access_token, 
                    access_secret=access_secret)
```

6. Collect tweets... That simple!

```{r}
tw_afghanistan <- searchTwitteR(searchString = "#Afghanistan", n = 5)
```

At this stage, you will have the tweets in the form of a list. You can check them out like any other list. For example, look at the first tweet `tw_afghanistan[[1]]`.
